Message.Issue: Declare the serialization constructor of 'DBProperties', an unsealed type, as protected.

'FilterFormConverter.BoxesToFilterControlSets(List<GroupBox>)' rethrows a caught exception and specifies it explicitly as an argument. Use 'throw' without an argument instead, in order to preserve the stack location where the exception was initially raised.

Implement IDisposable on 'OrclCommand' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'OracleConnection'. If 'OrclCommand' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'OracleCommand.OracleCommand(string, OracleConnection)' in 'OrclCommand.ExecuteOneParamProc(string, string, string, string)' could contain the following variables 'procedure'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Message.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Message.Issue: The query string passed to 'OracleCommand.OracleCommand(string)' in 'OrclCommand.RunQuery(string)' could contain the following variables 'sql'. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Implement ISerializable correctly
Rule.Description: If a type is assignable to ISerializable, it should implement GetObjectData. For unsealed types, the GetObjectData method should be callable and overridable by derived types.

Rule.Name: Implement serialization constructors
Rule.Description: The constructor signature accepts the same arguments as ISerializable.GetObjectData, namely, a SerializationInfo instance and a StreamingContext instance. The constructor should be protected for non-sealed classes and private for sealed classes. Failure to implement a serialization constructor will cause deserialization to fail, and throw a SerializationException.
Rule.Resolution: Declare the serialization constructor of {0}, an unsealed type, as protected.

Rule.Name: Rethrow to preserve stack details
Rule.Description: Use the IL rethrow instruction to preserve original stack details when re-raising a caught exception.
Rule.Resolution: {0} rethrows a caught exception and specifies it explicitly as an argument. Use 'throw' without an argument instead, in order to preserve the stack location where the exception was initially raised.

Rule.TypeName: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Name: Review SQL queries for security vulnerabilities
Rule.Description: A SQL command string built from user input is vulnerable to SQL injection attacks. Microsoft SQL Server and other database servers support stored procedures and parameterized SQL queries, which reduce the risk of injection attacks.
Rule.Resolution: The query string passed to {0} in {1} could contain the following variables {2}. If any of these variables could come from user input, consider using a stored procedure or a parameterized SQL query instead of building the query with string concatenations.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
